text: Margaret Hutton was a Canadian swimmer who competed internationally in freestyle events in the 1930s. She was a member of Border City SC. At the 1934 British Empire Games in London, she won a gold medal with the Canadian team in the 4×100-yard relay competition and another gold medal in the 3×110 yard medley relay. She won the ASA women’s 440 yard freestyle in 1939.Ladies 440 yard freestyle, history.swimming.org During the late 1940s and early 1950s she trained Kelowna swimmers in the summer period, while living in California, United States. In 1999 she was induced in the Ontario Aquatic Hall of Fame Inductees, as a swimming pioneer. == References == Category:Year of birth missing Category:Year of death missing Category:Canadian swimmers Category:Sportswomen
title: Margaret Hutton
